results.title: The Monsoon frog (A)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Dreamtime story”.
A young boy, learning to hunt is told never to harm the green frog. In answer to his question why, he is told the story of a young boy of the Dreamtime who had no respect for nature. When the monsoon did not come one year he threatened to kill the green frog, bringer of the monsoon, if she did not send the rain. In revenge she sent her children, thunder and lightning to kill him, but he meets with Tiddalik the giant frog, which causes further complications … Narrated by Belzah Lowah.

results.title: The Stolen canoe (A)
results.creator_credit: Robin James and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Dreamtime story”.
In this imaginative reconstruction of an Aboriginal legend, Ulamina, the selfish Starfish man will not share his canoe which allows him access to the rich fishing grounds of an offshore island. Bangura resolves to teach him a lesson and gains his trust to the point where he can steal his canoe. Ulamina pursues him, but as he cannot swim he is transformed into a starfish. Bangura himself has now broken nature’s law by stealing the canoe, which overturns and drowns him, becoming a rock in the process. Narrated by Belzah Lowah.

results.title: The Creation
results.creator_credit: Peter Cooke, Robin James and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Dreamtime story”.
In this imaginative interpretation of an Aboriginal creation myth, the spirits, Baime and Yhi breathe life into the planet Earth, creating plants and animals. However the animals quarrel, causing the Earth to split, releasing the evil spirit Marmoo, who destroys Baime and Yhi’s creation with fire. Baime punishes Marmoo by turning him into a snake. New forests grow from surviving seeds and the animals return but without Baime’s spirit, which he now breathes into his last creations, Man and Woman. Narrated by Bill Lowah.

results.title: Standing room only
results.creator_credit: Sidney Meyers, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS News
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Considers the implications of the world’s burgeoning population growth depicting ideas for distributing food surpluses, exploiting the oceans, increasing agricultural activity. Examines several of the procedures including birth control whereby this growth can be controlled. Reporter: Walter Cronkite.

results.title: Computer revolution. Parts 1 and 2
results.creator_credit: James Jackson, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
A timely - even frightening - reminder of the rapid advance computers are making into our lives. In many fields the impersonal efficient machine is shaping and controlling our destinies. The film points to the ever-increasing reliance on computers and illustrates computer applications of today and in the future specifically in production, aviation, medicine, education, law-enforcement, rocket space travel, design, communication etc. Implications for citizens’ rights to privacy. Reporter: Walter Cronkite.

results.title: The Class of '01: the college of tomorrow
results.creator_credit: Peter Poor, Isaac Kleinerman and Columbia Broadcasting System
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
A glimpse of what the universities of the future (2001) will be like. Examines new multi-media methods such as computerised control centres and closed circuit TV. Community colleges and the possible “bottling in film” of great professors are explained. Advanced methods of teacher training and new educational technologies are shown, and the question of what will happen to the creative processes in tomorrow’s classrooms is explored. Reporter: Walter Cronkite.

results.title: Tomorrow...today
results.creator_credit: James Jackson, Isaac Kleinerman, Columbia Broadcasting System and CBS News
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Examines the ways in which scientists simulate the future in order to solve tech;nological problems. Shows the lunar module of the Apollo project that landed on the moon, and demonstrates how the astronauts learned how to manoeuvre and land it. Also shows an airplane landing simulator, and a gymnast who simulates walking on the moon.

results.title: The Wild cell
results.creator_credit: Aram Boyajian, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS News
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Reviews what is known about the causes, diagnoses and treatments of cancer. Uses photo- micrography, animation, and multi-screen techniques to show how cancer effects and spreads through the body

group_siblings.title: What are we doing to our world

results.title: What are we doing to our world
results.creator_credit: Edmond Levy, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS News
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Discusses the serious changes in the ecology if many environments caused by industrial pollution, taking Lake Erie as an example. Oil, silt, sewage and various industrial wastes and pesticides have destroyed most of the lake’s fish. Also considers the effects of water and air pollution, including such problems as the “Greenhouse effect” from increased atmospheric carbon dioxide, which is influencing climate and the radioactive contamination arising from disposal of nuclear waste.
results.title_for_label: What are we doing to our world
results.creator_credit_for_label: Edmond Levy, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS News
